item.title: Theater of Absurd
item.description: Anti-Language No fixed pattern Characters talk disorderly What the character has said is not the words that his partner has asked or wanted to get.

item.title: Room of One's Own by Virginia Woolf
item.description: by [[Virginia Woolf]] Characters Mary Beton - Narrator Mary Seton - Mrs Beton’s friend Judith Shakespeare - Fictional sister of Shakespeare

item.title: A Portrait of The Artist as a Young Man
item.description: This is a movie based on the novel. A pale, boring 90 minute distillation of 299 pages. Something a 10 minute summary does a better job of.

item.title: America by Allen Ginsberg
Dawn At Puri by Jayanta Mahapatra
item.description: author: Jayanta Mahapatra Place: Puri, Orissa called “Gate of Heaven” dying there = auspicious talks about rites and rituals we don’t question, faith widows and what they faced

item.title: Imagine by John Lennon
item.description: no countries, no religion, no possessions, no division no hunger anti-war John Lennon asks us to imagine a world, a dream world where humanity is free of conflicts and barriers.

item.title: Nagamandala
item.description: [[Story Theatre]] Story within a story based on the two stories Karnad heard from his mentor, Prof Ramanujan based on folklore

item.title: Partition by W.H Auden
item.description: by W.H. Auden About the Author Summary and themes about the India - Pakistan partition in 1947 angry about partition, directed towards Radcliffe

item.title: Preludes
item.description: [!NOTE]- Poem The winter evening settes down With smell of steaks in passagewats Six o’clock The burnt-out ends of smoky days.

item.title: Sailing to Byzantium by WB Yeats
item.description: by ![[WB Yeats]] written in 1926 Yeats was in his 60s “the state of my soul and some of my thoughts about the subject” time of industrial revolution

item.title: Sem IV English Syllabus
item.description: Module 1: The Essay [[Room of Ones Own|Room of One’s Own]] The Character of Dogs- R. L Stevenson

item.title: Story Theatre
item.description: A type of theatre in which the performer tells a story using a combination of acting, mime, music, dance adapted from traditional folktale

item.description: important author - [[Virginia Woolf]] - Mrs Dalloway 2 Orlando

item.title: WB Yeats
item.description: Irish poet Symbolist Inspired by Pre-Raphaelites and William Blake poetry was a reaction to the naturalistic and realistic poetry of the Victorian age Won the Nobel dreams, imagination, visions, magic, and mysticism [[Sailing to Byzantium]]
